item.title: Chemicals Template
item.description:
METADATA
Identity
Name
Short name
IUPAC name
Other name
CAS number
Composition & structure
Molecular formula
H2O
Molecular weight

SAFETY
Global Harmonized System
Signal word
warning, danger
Physical hazard
Health hazard
Environmental hazard
Personal protection
Gloves
nitrile gloves, EN ISO 374-1 type A/B/C, EN ISO 374-5 bacteria & fungi + VIRUSES
Mask
not required
Fume hood
not required

Always try to minimize formation of dust and aerosols.
Always dispose of chemical waste according to institutional and local regulations.
Always consult institutional safety documentation and safety data sheet before use.
HANDLING
Physical properties
Appearance
white crystalline solid
Melting point
not determined
Boiling point
not determined
Solubility
x g/L in water, mostly insoluble in most organic solvents
pKa
pKa‚ÇÅ x.xx, pKa‚ÇÇ x.xx, pKa‚ÇÉ x.xx
Effective pH range
x.x-x.x
Acid/base properties
weak/strong acid/base with an effective buffering range pH x.x-x.x
Net charge
neutral at pH 7, negatively charged above pH x.x, positively charged below pH x.x
Isoelectric point
pI x.x
Stability & storage
Stability
stable in air
Storage conditions
room temperature
Shelf life
indefinite under proper storage conditions
Compatibility & Use
Typical stocks
Avoid contact with

References ‚ñ∏
  1. PubChem Second Referencing Style
  2. Carl Roth GmbH + Co. KG. PAGENAME. LINK. Accessed Jan. 2, 2026.
  3. Institut f√ºr Arbeitsschutz der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung (IFA), PAGENAME. LINK. Accessed Jan. 2, 2026.
Disclaimer
The information provided on this website is intended exclusively for trained professionals. It is supplied for general informational purposes only and does not replace official safety data sheets (SDS), institutional regulations, or legally required risk assessments.
The authors and operators assume no liability for any injury, damage, or loss resulting from the use or interpretation of the information provided. While every effort is made to ensure accuracy and currency, no guarantee is given that the information is complete, correct, or applicable to all situations. Users are responsible for verifying accuracy and compliance with all applicable regulations.
Links to example safety data sheets (SDS) for Germany in English are provided for reference only and may not reflect the exact product, formulation, batch, concentration, or regulatory status applicable to the user.

physical_hazard_classes = [ “explosive”, “flammable gas”, “flammable liquid”, “flammable solid”, “oxidizing agent”, “self-reactive substance”, “pyrophoric substance”, “self-heating substance”, “water-reactive substance”, “organic peroxide”, “gas under pressure”, “corrosive to metals”, “desensitized explosive” ] health_hazard_classes = [ “acute toxicity”, “skin corrosion”, “skin irritation”, “serious eye damage”, “eye irritation”, “respiratory sensitization”, “skin sensitization”, “germ cell mutagenicity”, “carcinogenicity”, “reproductive toxicity”, “specific target organ toxicity ‚Äì single exposure”, “specific target organ toxicity ‚Äì repeated exposure”, “aspiration hazard” ] environmental_hazard_classes = [ “hazardous to the aquatic environment ‚Äì acute”, “hazardous to the aquatic environment ‚Äì chronic”, “ozone layer hazard” ] signal_word = [ ‘warning’, ‘danger’ ] gloves = [ ’not required’, ’nitrile gloves, EN ISO 374-1 type A/B/C, EN ISO 374-5 bacteria & fungi + VIRUSES’ ‘double nitrile gloves recommended’, ‘butyl rubber gloves’, ’neoprene gloves’, ] mask = [ ’not required’, ‘surgical mask’, ‘FFP1 respirator’, ‘FFP2 respirator’, ‘FFP3 respirator’, ‘respirator with organic vapor filter (A)’, ‘respirator with organic vapor + particulate filter (A/P2)’, ‘respirator with organic vapor + particulate filter (A/P3)’ ] fume_hood = fume_hood = [ ’not required’, ‘recommended’, ‘required’, ‘required for weighing’, ‘required for solution preparation’, ‘required for heating’, ]

item.title: Methods Template
item.description:
1. Create a folder for the method.
  2. Create an _index.md:

+++ date = ‘2025-12-25T19:10:04+01:00’ draft = false construction = false title = ‘Western Blotting’ subtitle = ’' finished = true tested = true +++

  1. Create a markdown file per protocol variant.
  2. Enter on top of each markdown file:

{ {< variants >}}
